title: Replace app logos with uploaded Swaraj Infotech assets and remove all Caffeine AI branding

requirements.summary: Add newly uploaded logo assets and update learner app to use the new logo everywhere (including splash and header) with English alt text
acceptanceCriteria: Both uploaded image files are committed under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` (either as-is or as converted/cropped derivatives), and are referenced directly from the UI (not via backend).
`frontend/src/components/BrandHeader.tsx` no longer references the old logo path and displays the newly uploaded logo.
`frontend/src/components/SplashScreen.tsx` no longer references the old logo path and displays the newly uploaded logo.
No other learner-app screens show the previous logo asset anywhere (header areas, cards, empty states, etc.).
All user-facing text related to the logo (e.g., alt text) is in English.

file_operations.description: Add the newly uploaded Swaraj Infotech logo image as a static frontend asset (do not route through backend).
Add the newly uploaded Swaraj Infotech logo image variant as a static frontend asset (do not route through backend).
Ensure the required generated square logo image exists under this exact path and can be referenced by the UI as a static asset.
Ensure the required generated portrait poster image exists under this exact path and can be referenced by the UI as a static asset.
Create a centralized brand configuration (logo paths + English alt text) so the learner app can consistently reference the new logo assets from `frontend/public/assets/generated/`.
Update the header branding to use the new centralized brand logo path(s) and English alt text (remove any reference to the previous logo asset).

Update the splash screen to use the new centralized brand logo path(s) and English alt text (remove any reference to the previous logo asset). Optionally reference `frontend/public/assets/generated/swaraj-infotech-logo-poster.dim_1080x1920.png` as a decorative/background image while keeping the primary logo as the uploaded asset.
Replace the login-flow logo usage with the new centralized brand logo path(s) and English alt text so the old logo no longer appears on the auth screen.

requirements.summary: Remove all Caffeine AI branding across learner app and Admin Panel while keeping Swaraj Infotech branding and English text
acceptanceCriteria: A repo-wide search in the frontend codebase shows no remaining user-visible references to "Caffeine" or "Caffeine AI".
Learner app UI contains no Caffeine/Caffeine AI branding in headers, footers, splash screen, login flow, dashboard, or settings/profile areas.
Admin Panel UI contains no Caffeine/Caffeine AI branding in its login screen, shell/header/sidebar, or any admin screens.
All user-facing text remains in English after removals.

file_operations.description: Add/confirm any brand name strings and reuse them across learner/admin UI to avoid lingering third-party branding in user-facing text.

Audit and remove/replace any user-visible "Caffeine" / "Caffeine AI" text that may appear in the learner app flow (including splash/authenticated shell transitions), keeping all user-facing text in English.
Audit footer/help area for any Caffeine/Caffeine AI mentions and remove them if present, keeping the remaining support text in English.

Audit the Admin Panel shell (header/sidebar/footer areas) and remove any Caffeine/Caffeine AI branding if present; optionally swap the header icon block to display the centralized Swaraj Infotech logo from `frontend/public/assets/generated/` for consistent branding.

Audit the Admin Panel login screen for any Caffeine/Caffeine AI mentions and remove them if present, keeping the remaining copy in English; optionally display the centralized Swaraj Infotech logo from `frontend/public/assets/generated/` for consistent branding.
Audit the learner app HTML shell for any Caffeine/Caffeine AI branding (e.g., title/meta) and remove/replace if present, keeping English text.
Audit the admin HTML shell for any Caffeine/Caffeine AI branding (e.g., title/meta) and remove/replace if present, keeping English text.
